build n0425

I am downgrading to critical because there is a workaround (restart).

I did some profiling and I found that if you repeatedly switch between two launch configurations in the launch configuration dialog, entire launch config tabs (e.g. Common Tab, Environment Tab), etc are being leaked, and they are still holding on to all their widgets, causing Windows to run out of handles and no more widgets can be created.

I am not sure whether it is Debug leaking or someone else, but Debug seems like the right place to start.

Created an attachment (id=40657)
screenshot

I wasn't able to generate a report with TPTP so I'm attaching a screenshot showing some of the objects leaked. I alternated between the Eclipse Application launch config type node and a specific instance of that type 5 times. This is reflected in the number of objects leaked.

Created an attachment (id=40658)
screenshot

Used the wrong content type for the previous attachment. Here it is again.

When switching between launch config types we should be disposing of the CTabFolder and recreating it instead of trying to reuse it. Disposing of the CTabItems is not sufficient as the items are just widgets, the actual controls on the tabs are parented by the tab folder.

Created an attachment (id=40747)
minimal patch

Smaller patch that does not change the setRedraw locations.

Risk: This is a simple fix with minimal risk. We dipose/recreate the tab folder rather than the tab items.

CC'ing Steve for RC4 approval.
